video.title: AWS AppSync Tutorial - GraphQL APIs with AppSync, Amplify and Angular
video.description:
AWS AppSync automatically updates the data in web and mobile applications in real time, and updates data for offline users as soon as they reconnect. Learn how to use it to build a GraphQL API using Amplify and Angular.

💻 Course created by Manoj Fernando. Check out his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChpIik3lwpviVj_tIoCeUHw

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00) Introduction to GraphQL APIs with AppSync, Amplify and Angular
⌨️ (26:19) Modeling Relationships (1:1 | 1:N | M:N)
⌨️ (57:01) How to send realtime updates with GraphQL subscriptions
⌨️ (1:06:20) Let's Build an Offline Web App

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://www.freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Swetha Eparampara
topLevelComment.text: this.api.createTodo method throwing  error that not available

replies.author: Ragav Y
replies.text:
I believe you are talking about the "property 'onCreate' does not exist on type 'OnCreateSubscription'." error. This is a typing error thrown in recent versions of Angular. You can bypass this by specifying the type of the todo as any. 

So inside the arrow function's input, instead of "(todo)=>", use "(tody: any) =>".

This will fix the error.

topLevelComment.author: Maanas Muddam
topLevelComment.text:
Hi at 18.25, when I do ng serve I am getting the following error:
core.js:6228 ERROR TypeError: Cannot read property 'viewContainerRef' of undefined
    at AuthenticatorComponent.push../node_modules/aws-amplify-angular/__ivy_ngcc__/dist/src/components/authenticator/authenticator/authenticator.factory.js.AuthenticatorComponent.loadComponent (authenticator.factory.js:47)

Browser isn't displaying the auth page. Any Ideas on how to fix this issue? Thanks!

replies.author: Gustav Vingtoft
replies.text:
For those interested and/or facing same problem: 

"Angular 9 is not supported in the legacy version of the Angular UI Components. If your app is using Angular 9, please see our new Angular UI Component package."

Source: https://docs.amplify.aws/ui-legacy/q/framework/angular

topLevelComment.author: Nithyashree V
topLevelComment.text: What are the prerequisites to understand this topic?

replies.author: Ragav Y
replies.text: You should already know some Angular. This is more of an introduction to AWS. You'll probably only understand this fully if you have already worked with Angular, otherwise there are too many new topics here for you to grasp this fully.
